str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.
From hamartano; a sin.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
And, even, also, namely.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From hamartano; a sin.
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
And, even, also, namely.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Perhaps from a and the base of meros; properly, to miss the mark, i.e. to err, especially to sin.
